thread.title: Furious Alexis Sanchez didn't speak to ANYBODY in the dressing room after Arsenal draw with Bournemouth
thread.title_full: Furious Alexis Sanchez didn't speak to ANYBODY in the dressing room after Arsenal draw with Bournemouth

author: John Cross
title: Furious Alexis Sanchez didn't speak to ANYBODY in the dressing room after Arsenal draw with Bournemouth
text:
Sport Furious Alexis Sanchez didn't speak to ANYBODY in the dressing room after Arsenal draw with Bournemouth Fresh fears over future of star whose reaction to Tuesday draw was very different to some of his team-mates' Share It was an amazing fightback — but clearly Sanchez felt Arsenal should have won the game (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Alexis Sanchez carried on his Bournemouth hissy-fit into the Arsenal dressing room - leaving his team-mates fearing he will leave. 
Striker Sanchez threw a tantrum on the pitch after Tuesday’s 3-3 draw , throwing his gloves to the floor and visibly showing his frustration over the Gunners suffering a major blow to their title hopes. 
The Chile international, currently locked in a contract stand-off, was obviously furious with his team-mates and the result, and did not speak to anyone afterwards. 
One source suggested Sanchez - known for his fiery temper - was angry at seeing players celebrating their fightback from 3-0 down with 20 minutes to go because he saw even a point at Bournemouth as a bad result if they want to win the title. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger faces the press after Bournemouth draw Share this video Watch Next 
Angry travelling fans had earlier chanted, “This is embarrassing” as Arsene Wenger’s men were torn apart by goals from Charlie Daniels, Callum Wilson and Ryan Fraser. 
Though Arsenal climbed off the canvas with Sanchez, Lucas Perez and Olivier Giroud netting, the latter angered watching supporters — and clearly stunned Sanchez and other team-mates — with a celebration dance that wasted precious seconds which could have been used to chase a winner. 
The draw left Arsenal eight points behind leaders Chelsea, having played a game more. 
Wenger said: “We dropped two points but we have to do better in the other games and hope other teams will drop points. It was not a result we wanted before the game but at 3-0 down we’d have signed for 3-3. We were unlucky in some decisions.” Sanchez seemingly can't believe what he is seeing with time left to win the match 
Sanchez, whose contract expires in 2018, has been offered a new deal worth £180,000-a-week to stay but has also had a interest from China worth more than double that amount. 
The 28-year-old has stalled on signing and made it plain he wants success as well as improved terms, leaving some of his team-mates believing he does already have an offer from another club lined up. poll loading Will Alexis Sanchez sign a new deal at Arsenal? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
